thread.title: Hundreds of Connecticut power outages reported amid storm that brought rain, strong winds - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: Hundreds of Connecticut power outages reported amid storm that brought rain, strong winds - NewsBreak

title: Hundreds of Connecticut power outages reported amid storm that brought rain, strong winds - NewsBreak
text: Hundreds of residents in Connecticut are without power as the state is getting hit by a storm bringing strong winds and rain Wednesday. The rain started as showers Wednesday afternoon and intensified as the evening went on. The National Weather Service is projecting that will continue into overnight hours before scattering and tapering off early Thursday. Along with the rain, wind speeds were expected to pick up throughout the day into overnight hours before calming down Thursday. Scattered thunderstorms were also possible, the weather service said. With the stormy weather , Connecticut started to sees hundreds of power outages early Wednesday evening. Eversource, the state's largest utility company, reported 1,214 outages as of 7 p.m. Most of those outages were in Danbury and Rocky Hill, where it reported 733 and 270, respectively. United Illuminating, which covers parts of Fairfield and New Haven counties, reported 422 outages at the same time. The vast majority of those were in Bridgeport.
